title: To the guy who leaves a 4 vs 5, making it a 3 vs 5,
body:
Thanks. You just made what we could have salvaged now impossible. All because you didn't think it was worth it.

WELL, we defended for 25 minutes without you. We even aced them at one point. WISH YOU WERE THERE,

Signed, 

Your still fighting teammates.

replies.body: The really depressing thing is when your 4v5 turns into 2v5. One guy DCed, and then two other people were like "4v5 GG" and left. The other guy reconnected 10 seconds later, and then said he quit since two other guys already left. Now *that* is terrible.
We got some Romeo and Juliet shit going on over here.

> We got some Romeo and Juliet shit going on over here.

That was perfect
Wow........just wow.
Yeah exactly, 4 v 5's are still possible. I'd rather report that guy than the first. At least you know that they actually quit and are the scum of this community.

> Yeah exactly, 4 v 5's are still possible. I'd rather report that guy than the first. At least you know that they actually quit and are the scum of this community.

4v5's are actually easier epecially if your team is less skilled.

The team with 5 typically gets less experience, and often gets cocky because of the situation, making stupid plays because they thing 5v4 makes it an auto win. You can take advantage of that, snowball and often win early.
That, or they split push to win because you don't have the resources to stop them.

> Yeah exactly, 4 v 5's are still possible. I'd rather report that guy than the first. At least you know that they actually quit and are the scum of this community.

I gladly report both :)

but yeah.  it ticks me off because my friends do this sometimes *to me*
"it was 4v5 we weren't going to win"
"we were down 10 kills and drag at 15 minutes we weren't going to win"

^Yeah. Probably.  But I'm going to finish the game I signed up to play because I promised my team that I would, and who knows - we *might* win.

{{champion:54}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:61}} 

Believe in the dream.
Why is everyone saying that 4v5 isnt possible to win? Its possible to win, but there is a time limit before when your power gets overwhelmed by sheer number of bodies.

I see more comments about them saying it's basically a low chance rate to win 4v5, not that it's impossible. It's just stupid to bet on that chance for the next 30 minutes before they blow your nexus. I have won about three 4v5 before if I can recount, but that was because I can clearly see the other team was dumb as hell (ex. Aniv and Jax decided baron TWICE by themselves at 1/3 health). But if you're one of those who still wants to fight it out when the team can't even step into the jungle without getting obliterated simply because of numbers, 3-22 kills, # of inhibs down, then (not personally to you) f*** you for wasting time. I wouldn't even be mad if someone left after playing some mind-numbing 4v5 game. The asshat that left in the first place and never went back is who I'm reporting.

I feel like the match should just end right when that happens but it's a loss forgiven-like end. The team that lost loses no LP except for the AFKers, who lose twice the LP(but only if they actually quit the match. gotta be fair to those who suffer from dc)
People would team up and rage at someone to force him to leave so they don't lose LP. If you can abuse it people will abuse it.

> People would team up and rage at someone to force him to leave so they don't lose LP. If you can abuse it people will abuse it.

Why would anyone leave because someone is raging at them? Are people THAT much of a sissy nowadays that they cant take words?
The point is people would abuse the system if it's possible.

> People would team up and rage at someone to force him to leave so they don't lose LP. If you can abuse it people will abuse it.

This is similar to how the "Refer a Friend" system was abused. That aspect of the game is probably the biggest reason Riot can't make changes to LeaveBuster

I think it is becoming impossible to be sure that a person who is afk is afk of their own will anymore or due to riot server issues. Based on my own recent experiences over the past so many months. I'm becoming less comfortable reporting people unless they make it blatant with text.
but winning a 3v5 gives you a huge sense of satisfaction

I literally had this happen to me recently in ranked. 

Our mid laner disconnected without warning about a minute into the match (before minions spawned) and never returned. I was supporting and doing just fine in bot lane with my ADC. We were even stomping the enemy ADC and support Ryze (I know...) pretty well and the other lanes were doing fine also.

However, it wasn't good enough for our ADC. He kept threatening to leave because of the 4v5, thinking it's a waste of time, never mind that he was pretty fed and the other ADC was shut down. Then finally, he says bye and leaves. If that wasn't bad enough, yet another ally decided to leave too, making it a 2v5. 

I believe we would have won if he stayed. I was so upset about it since if I remember right, it was a series match. 

Only my team, though. Enemy team never has an afk. :|
The bottom line is that there are too many angry people who don't even like playing this game and are just addicted to it.  I finish all my games because I actually enjoy playing, win or lose.

This is truly mind-boggling. You know if would be epic if you win the game when you're down a person (and as the game goes on, you would have never imagined playing a game where you were literally inches away from winning the game). At this point, you REALLY wish that 4th player came back cause you know you can win the game with some extra help.

I love it when I get to make epic comebacks when my team is down members. I also understand, though, it's aggravating when it's clear you can win the game with some extra players which of course you don't have. Winning this game only gets harder when it becomes a 3 v 5. It's still possible to make that epic play, at the same time, but it's definitely harder.

Anyway though, here's my own rule for surrendering: Never give up the game unless you're not having a good time.
I agree with your rule for surrendering. I also don't begrudge anyone for voting "no" and continue trying my best even if I called the surrender vote.

I've had those "epic 4v5" comebacks, but I don't understand the rush you claim to get from accomplishing it. It pretty much means that the enemy team was absolutely incompetent. Usually, they do the thing that gets a free win: 1-3-1 with ward control, split pushing and getting towers. Even if you have a huge lead, by the time their support has 6 items (since you shouldn't ever have more than one lane past the river) it doesn't what early lead you had.

I've won probably 25-35% of my 4v5 games, because my team doesn't give up. You only have to pick off 1 opponent and the fight is now even. Children that complain about the 4v5 or anything else have never really figured out how to deal with hard situations in life. Personally, I find myself far happier winning a 4v5 when I'm on the 4 side, but then again, children don't understand working for anything and automatically give up. That type of mentality is why this generation is so lazy. That type of mentality is also what makes trolls... well troll right after first blood or "mid or feed". Neither helps your team at all. Neither improves your chances of winning. 

Calling someone a cellar dweller doesn't make you look any better than that mega edgy "666" in your name. Memory braggarts..? Of course you're really just trying to put down someone instead of providing legit advice, oh wait, because "I'm sooooo goood I win 2-4 v 5 all the time"

Honestly, I respect the 4v5 team that goes down valiantly, even if it was in {{champion:67}} and would rather tell the crybabies to screw off. I don't care what rank you are, I come here to play this game. Not babysit you because a game went wrong and you're crying about it xD GG NO RE

Honestly, I don't blame that person. Literally, 99% of the 4v5 games are losses. I've played since beta and only won maybe 2-3 4v5s, ever. I wouldn't be mad at the person who left the 4v5, making it 3v5. I'd instead redirect the frustration towards Riot, who fails to give a fuck about proper measures to counter-act accidental DCs, etc.

I've been playing since season 3, and I kid you not, I've probably won at least 15 4v5s, and one 3v5 (some of them were in my promos, two of them I remember distinctly being in my silver 1 to gold 5 promos). I think it has to do with your attitude and how easy some people give up. I think that's my greatest strength as a player, no matter how terrible things seem to be going, I always try my best to find a way to win the game. I've been in lanes where I was so far behind the enemy laner that simply showing up to lane would spell my immediate death and still ended a lot of those games with good scores and a positive impact on the team, I've had games where a troll would instalock garen after we already have a jungler and a top laner locked in, I've had games where I was supposed to swap champions with someone and he afkd in champ select (this is the story of how I ended up playing Lee sin for my first time in gold promos with AP runes and masteries). But I won a lot of those games because I wanted to win more than the enemy team did.
I kid you not i won a 2v5 with Riven top. I went 32/2/16. Never give up even with 3 afk's :D
How would Riot counter-act an accidental dc or leavers?
Loss prevented or something?
Riot, I have a suggestion. If someone leaves matchmaker, make the leaver give everyone in the match 10 IP. If someone leaves a match, make the leaver give everyone left on the team 50 IP.
The only reason you managed to defend that long is because they didn't give a crap since it was a certain victory. If they were a little more serious thing would be the same.
It's quite depressing, and even more when they are still at the keyboard and begin arguing that they shouldn't be reported for leaving the game.
to the guys who try to 1 v 3 when we have a lead because u are too "cocky" i hate u!

I have won a 2 v 5 before, all you have to do is split push when they are taking objectives; sell all your items to attack damage items and push to the end. 
And too those who don't believe you can win a 4v5... you obviously aren't the one that is carrying the game.

The worst is when some dude gets mad and bails on a 4v5 never to return... and then the first disconnect comes back a minute later.

Be patient my friends, he might always come back.

The game is not over until the end, but I'd like to make you notice that GD used to say "you should carry". And at the reply "but I have 2 teammates that are 0/25/0" they reply "if you can not carry, then you belong there".
Having AFKs is better than intentional feeders (at least they don't steal experience/give money), so you should carry on your own.

I obviously don't think that, but that was I was told a lot of time, and just wanted to put it into prospective for all the people that use to say it.

I once won a 5v1. The poor guy tried to defend until the last tower. He got 5 honorable opponent, that are the people that make this game good.

I'm all for understanding people if they legitimately have something unplanned, and let's be fair, gaming isn't the most important thing in the world, but for people who leave on purpose, simply because they don't feel like trying, no. Just no.

> Thanks. You just made what we could have salvaged now impossible. All because you didn't think it was worth it.
> 
> WELL, we defended for 25 minutes without you. We even aced them at one point. WISH YOU WERE THERE,
> 
> Signed, 
> 
> Your still fighting teammates.

stop being a delusional prick, it is near impossible to win a 4 v 5 and the rare times it does happen all it shows is how brokent he ranking system and match making is that you could beat  another team when you have 1 less player.

So typical asshat, here you are blaming not the guy who went afk and ruined your game, but the other guy who didnt want to suffer through it because you were hoping that was gonna be your miracle for the year.

You are new to LoL. It's obvious, because you just said ''it's near impossible to win a 4v5'', if you weren't new you'd know just how common it is to win 4v5s. Well I'm breaking it to you, it's actually not that rare to win 4v5s so stop going afk in matches kthx.

> You are new to LoL. It's obvious, because you just said ''it's near impossible to win a 4v5'', if you weren't new you'd know just how common it is to win 4v5s. Well I'm breaking it to you, it's actually not that rare to win 4v5s so stop going afk in matches kthx.

No but you must be. Sorry i play thousands of ranked games a year i et my fair share of 4v5 going bot ways, i almost never lose a 5 on4 and i almsot never win a 4 v 5. Maybe in normals where you are stomping weak players it happens but in ranked you might win 1 out of 20ish 4v5's which imho is rare and not worth the anger.

To be clear my position is for if you have a teammate who actually goes AFK, not someoone who d/c or doesnt conect, in those cases i am happy to play it out and hope they reconnect and i can salvage a win.

also ps to all the mrons who pretend 4v5 is some easy win, please save your bs ego stories lol. yes we have all won a 4 v 5 but it rarely happens.

Not with that attitude that's for sure. You should only give up/stop playing if everyone on your team stops caring and wants to give up (which is very rare).

You have been playing since season 1 and I have been playing since season 3, you probably have 5x more matches played than me (or more) and yet you are in gold (which is still better than most players, not trying to be condescending here) while I am platinum. Maybe, just maybe, it has to do with how easily you are willing to give up?

Then you realize on this account i am plat 3, while you are a cellar dweller at 0lp plat 5. I also did it in a fraction of the games you took to get plat 5 0lp (not trying to be condescending). Just like that magically your thought it has ANYTHING to specifically do with me is meaningless including my attitude.

So ya sorry you just learned 2 things. Ranking means very little in this game unless you are the top of d1 and above or rock bottom bronze 5. Turns out neither does the number of games played mean anything. Both are twisted to satisfy idiots egos nothing more nothing less.

So stay delusional waste your time in 4v5 in ranked, me i prefer to call it a loss rather than chuck in my heart and soul for if i am lucky a 5% at best chance to win. The fact still remains the OP is a moron for blaming the second guy to leave and not accept the fact it was the first guy who went AFK that was the sole and only problem in the scenario. Nothing anyone has said even addresses that. Just a pile of selective memory braggarts acting like they are sooo good they win 2-4 v 5 all the time lol.
It is rare. If it wasn't rare most of us would not be in elo hell because of it. Stop your bullshit talk.
Elo hell has nothing to do with 4v5s. Its about skill.
I've won a 3v5 before. I went from 5v5 to 4v5 to 3v5 to 3v4. Just make someone on the other team rage quit and then faceroll the remaining enemies.

> I've won a 3v5 before. I went from 5v5 to 4v5 to 3v5 to 3v4. Just make someone on the other team rage quit and then faceroll the remaining enemies.

If someone rage quits on the other team it's not a 4v5 anymore.

Don't let the score be 1-20 at 11 minutes with 2 inhibs down and that wont happen

Sincerely, the guy who likes to play actual league of legends games

Whatever the score is never leave a game.

Sincerely, someone who isn't a raging asshole afker
People like you are the reason people are toxic. People who dont understand how the game works and that you can't win every game
Carry harder.
